meanings.definition: To gradually discontinue or eliminate something.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to phaseout the old product line to make room for new items.
meanings.sent2: It is important for businesses to phaseout outdated technology to stay competitive.
meanings.sent3: The slow phaseout of sugary drinks in the vending machine caused quite a stir among employees.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, it seems to phaseout the bustling city into a peaceful evening.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a gradual phaseout of recess time to help students transition back to learning.

meanings.definition: The act of phasing out or discontinuing something gradually.
meanings.sent1: The phaseout of single-use plastics in the office was a positive step towards sustainability.
meanings.sent2: During the phaseout of the old policy, employees were trained on the new procedures.
meanings.sent3: The phaseout of the popular snack machine left many employees craving their favorite treats.
meanings.sent4: The phaseout of the old building made way for a modern, energy-efficient structure.
meanings.sent5: The gradual phaseout of traditional farming methods led to increased productivity in the region.
